授業目的: The purpose of this lecture is to study about four topics in development economics: (i) theory of economic growth, (ii) economic development and foreign aid, (iii) economic development and international trade, (iv) economic development and environment.
到達目標:
(1) Students understand the key points for each topic.
(2) Students collect data relevant to each topic from databases compiled by World Bank, UNCTAD, and OECD.
(3) Students present their own opinions on a specific question for each topic.

第1回:
Economic development 1 (All lecture will be delivered in face-to-face format)
・Introduction
・How much has our life improved?
第2回:
Economic development 2
・Why and how do our income grow?
・Solow model
第3回:
Economic development and foreign aid 1
・Official development assistance (ODA): definitions, characteristics and new trends
第4回:
Data exercises
・Using OECD Creditor Reporting System
第5回:
Economic development and foreign aid 2
・Japanese ODA: origin, evolution, and characteristics
第6回:
Economic development and foreign aid 3
・Impacts of ODA on recipient countries
第7回:
Economic development and foreign aid 4
・Impacts of ODA on donor countries
第9回:
Economic development and internatinal trade 1
・What makes export performance of poor countries so poor?
第10回:
Data exercises
・Using UNCTAD trade database
第11回:
Economic development and environment 1
・Environmental Kuznets Curve (EKC) hypothesis
第12回:
Data exercises
・Using OECD Stats
第13回:
Economic development and environment 2
・Policy interventions: What can we learn from Japan?

成績評価Grading2: 授業外学修課題／Assignment, homework required outside class (06)
Students are evaluated by accuracy for data exercise.
成績評価Grading3: プレゼンテーション・発表／Presentation (07)
Students are evaluated by clarity, depth of understanding, and oral presentation.
